result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron E Brandau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aaron E Brandau in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Restitution has been paid. Attorney Bricco makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #2 
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

120 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS concurrent to count #3. 
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;	
No contact with Victims listed in the criminal complaint, their family or residence. 
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Sign Medical Release for Agent;
Seek employment;
Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.
Condition Time: 10 days Huber NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
COSTS:  $253.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Expunction is denied. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #3
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
120 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS concurrent to count #2. 
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;	
No contact with Victims listed in the criminal complaint, their family or residence. 
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Sign Medical Release for Agent;
Seek employment;
Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.
COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
Expunction is denied.

Defendant Aaron E Brandau in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to counts # 2 and 3.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  Court schedules sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
